Row.Text: Greetings, lady Remilia Scarlet, the Eternally Young Scarlet Moon. Your subordinates bow to your immortal rule, and no visitor is left unswayed by your undying charisma.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You are the mistress of the Scarlet Devil Mansion, whose history is as shrouded as the land itself. Located at the edge of Misty Lake, it stands as a monument to Gensokyo's many mysteries. From the clock tower to the magical library, every visitor has been awestruck by its magnificent - and should I add, well maintained - splendor. Its many powerful and loyal inhabitants have always ensured the mansion's success, and under the rule of the Lady herself, will never fail in doing so.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Oh Scarlet Moon, will you continue the prosperous grandeur of your estate? Or will you spread the mists to the world's furthest reaches, and unite all beings under the scarlet banner? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?

The Scarlet Estate, located at the edge of Misty Lake, has been around for an unknown amount of time. Its eye-catching feature is the clock tower rising up from the red rooftops. Surrounding the mansion stands a brick wall, its gate being protected by the somewhat lazy yet loyal Hong Meiling. Inside the mansion you'll find the magic Library and its librarian Patchouli Knowledge, and the many corridors whose cleanliness is under the constant supervision of the Chief Maid Sakuya Izayoi. Underneath it all you'll find the mansion's little secret, Remilia's sister Flandre. You don't want to meet Flandre.

The mistress of the Scarlet Devil Mansion. As indicated by her wings and appetite for blood, she is a vampire, and as such cannot stand sunlight. Although she's not as evil as vampires are generally portrayed, she isn't exactly sparkly either. Underestimating her can cause blood loss, death and a broken keyboard.
+1 XP per turn for Units in owned territory, up to Level 4. Reduces [ICON_CULTURE] Culture cost of acquiring new tiles by 25%.
+1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science for every 2 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in this City.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food from Lake tiles.

The Magic Library is perhaps the most iconic part of the Scarlet Devil Mansion. Commonly referred to as "Voile", or "Voile, the Magic Library", it is said to hold many of Gensokyo's magic books. But why would you believe this Civilopedia entry? Ask the resident Librarian, Patchouli Knowledge, yourself. Who knows, she might let you take a look (she won't).

The Magic Library is Remilia's unique building, replacing the Library. In addition to the Library's increase in [ICON_RESEARCH] Science gain, it provides +1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness and Lake tiles yield +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food.

Improves [ICON_FOOD] Food [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_GOLD] Gold by constructing Improvements on map tiles outside of Cities.[NEWLINE]This Unit is not slowed by rough terrain and works faster than a regular Worker.

Fairy Maids form the backbone of the Scarlet Devil Mansion's many rooms and corridors. Led by the Chief Maid Sakuya Izayoi, they ensure the mansion remains presentable for even the uninvited guests. They may not be the strongest members of the household, but any half-civilized person will take a shine to their cleaning prowess.

The Fairy Maid is Remilia's unique unit, replacing the Worker. Where the Worker has great difficulty traversing the many hills, forests and rivers it needs to work on, the Fairy Maid will simply fly over them. Due to this and their 25% higher work rate, you'll find the Fairy Maid to be more effective at working tiles in your empire than a common peasant.
Welcome to the mansion, stranger. Cup of tea?
Welcome, my name is Remilia Scarlet. Mistress of the Scarlet Devil Mansion.
I see, we have a visitor. Make yourself at home. Ask the maid if you need anything.
So, what will you be doing next?
Aha, victory is sweet. Now stay out of my lands.
Pfft, I see you were no match for my staff. Pathetic. Go on home, now, would you?
I suppose we can't talk this over at one of your shrines?
Alright, alright. Let's get some tea and forget about this.
Oh, um, okay. Could we talk over a cup of tea?
Did you just barge in here? You can use the door, you know.
It's a bit one-sided like this, don't you think?
I don't think this is entirely fair.
Sure, sure. What will you do with it?
Did you honestly think I'd agree with that?
Say, what do you think of this?
I could use a little funding for some mansion business.
It's good to see you again.
I think you can do better than that. You can, right?
I'm not so sure... it could be better.
If you throw in a little more, I think we'll have a really nice deal.
Oh, no, I'm afraid I'll decline.
Oh, okay. Take good care of it!
No, I won't. What's up with you?
Ooh, could you look at this? I'm sure you'll love it.
I'm afraid I need to ask you a little favor. Not a big problem for you, is it?
So, what are you here for?
You need to come with more if you want to be taken seriously.
Who do you think I am?
Alright. Now go before I change my mind.
Could you consider this? I think it will benefit us both.
Give this to me. I could put it to far better use.
I believe you're sitting on my land, and you're not invited.
My staff will be there in a moment to claim what's mine. Any resistance will be dealt with.
You're hopeless. I will not accept a future with you still crawling around.
Looks like it's going to be a fun night.
The moon is red. I'll kill you for sure.
